alert.note: Alert for Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 14 at 2:45PM EDT until June 14 at 6:21PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Meigs. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 241 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms Monday afternoon and night. The Shade River near Chester was above its 17-foot bank full stage at 17.8 feet, and slowly rising. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain fell Monday afternoon and night. The river should crest this afternoon or by early this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tuppers Plains, Chester and Darwin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
